At  [37-47], the person is seen cutting several cracks at the top of the coconut and prying it open to reveal the white coconut meat and water inside. A wooden razor is used to scrape the coconut meat off the surface. 

Earlier, at [27-37], the person was cutting off the white surface on the side of the coconut, revealing the smooth surface inside. This aligns with the sequence described in Option A, which includes slicing off the white edges and cutting off the bottom. The current segment continues this process by cracking the top to reveal the meat and water, pouring out the water, flattening the top, and scraping the meat.

Option A encompasses all these steps, including the initial removal of the green outer skin, cutting and shaping the top, polishing with a grinder, slicing off the white edges, cutting off the bottom, showing the smooth coconut, cracking the top to reveal the meat and water, pouring out the water, flattening the top, scraping the meat, and finally refilling and sealing with plastic wrap.
